intro: Micranthes lyallii, commonly known as Lyall's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
